snippet: A two-bedroom in the $1.4 million to $3 million range can be difficult to come by in the Manhattan market.
abstract: Tight credit market and a scarcity of listings have made it difficult for even very qualified buyers to find two-bedroom apartments in Manhattan; market for such apartments, usually in the $1.4 million to $3 million range, has contracted significantly in 2012.
lead_paragraph: A two-bedroom in the $1.4 million to $3 million range can be difficult to come by in the Manhattan market.

headline.seo: Trading Up Can Be Hard to Do
headline.main: Trading Up Can Be Hard to Do
headline.print_headline: Trading Up Can Be Hard to Do
